etymology.description: 生(生) (shēng, "life, grow") duplicated -> representing abundant growth or many creatures being born
etymology.interpretation: The duplication of 生(生) (shēng, "life, grow") emphasizes the idea of multiplication and proliferation, symbolizing abundant growth or a multitude of beings emerging.

examples.chinese: 他拿起甡(他拿起甡)，轻轻扫落叶(輕輕掃落葉)。
examples.pinyin: Tā ná qǐ shēn, qīng qīng sǎo luò yè.
examples.english: He picked up the broom and gently swept the fallen leaves.

examples.chinese: 我买了一把甡(我買了一把甡)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le yī bǎ shēn.
